1: %% @doc Common Test suite for router_result_consumer
    2: -module(router_result_consumer_SUITE).
    3: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
    4: %% Note: this suite does not use records/macros from beamline_router.hrl; remove include to avoid compile-time path issues.
    5: 
    6: -export([all/0, init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1]).
    7: -export([
    8:     test_result_parsing/1,
    9:     test_result_correlation/1,
   10:     test_usage_emission/1,
   11:     test_result_validation/1,
   12:     test_malformed_json/1,
   13:     test_missing_fields/1
   14: ]).
   15: 
   16: %% Helper functions for bounded waits
   17: -export([
   18:     wait_for_app_start/2,
   19:     wait_for_meck_call/4,
   20:     wait_for_no_meck_call/4
   21: ]).
   22: 
   23: all() ->
   24:     [
   25:         test_result_parsing,
   26:         test_result_correlation,
   27:         test_usage_emission,
   28:         test_result_validation,
   29:         test_malformed_json,
   30:         test_missing_fields
   31:     ].
   32: 
   33: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   34:     _ = application:load(beamline_router),
   35:     ok = application:set_env(beamline_router, grpc_port, 0),
   36:     ok = application:set_env(beamline_router, grpc_enabled, false),
   37:     ok = application:set_env(beamline_router, nats_mode, mock),
   38:     ok = application:set_env(beamline_router, result_subject, <<"caf.exec.result.v1">>),
   39:     ok = application:set_env(beamline_router, usage_subject, <<"beamline.usage.v1.metered">>),
   40:     case application:ensure_all_started(beamline_router) of
   41:         {ok, _} ->
   42:             %% Wait for router_result_consumer to be ready (bounded wait)
   43:             wait_for_app_start(router_result_consumer, 1000),
   44:             Config;
   45:         Error ->
   46:             ct:fail("Failed to start beamline_router: ~p", [Error])
   47:     end.
   48: 
   49: end_per_suite(Config) ->
   50:     application:stop(beamline_router),
   51:     Config.
   52: 
   53: %% @doc Wait for application process to be ready (bounded polling)
   54: wait_for_app_start(ProcessName, MaxWaitMs) ->
   55:     wait_for_app_start(ProcessName, MaxWaitMs, 10).
   56: 
   57: wait_for_app_start(ProcessName, MaxWaitMs, IntervalMs) when MaxWaitMs > 0 ->
   58:     case whereis(ProcessName) of
   59:         undefined ->
   60:             timer:sleep(IntervalMs),
   61:             wait_for_app_start(ProcessName, MaxWaitMs - IntervalMs, IntervalMs);
   62:         Pid when is_pid(Pid) ->
   63:             %% Process exists, verify it's alive
   64:             case is_process_alive(Pid) of
   65:                 true -> ok;
   66:                 false ->
   67:                     timer:sleep(IntervalMs),
   68:                     wait_for_app_start(ProcessName, MaxWaitMs - IntervalMs, IntervalMs)
   69:             end
   70:     end;
   71: wait_for_app_start(ProcessName, _MaxWaitMs, _IntervalMs) ->
   72:     ct:fail("Timeout waiting for ~p to start", [ProcessName]).
   73: 
   74: %% @doc Wait for meck function to be called (bounded polling)
   75: %% Args can be a list or '_' for any arguments
   76: wait_for_meck_call(Module, Function, Args, MaxWaitMs) ->
   77:     wait_for_meck_call(Module, Function, Args, MaxWaitMs, 10).
   78: 
   79: wait_for_meck_call(Module, Function, Args, MaxWaitMs, IntervalMs) when MaxWaitMs > 0 ->
   80:     %% Check if function was called with matching arguments
   81:     case Args of
   82:         '_' ->
   83:             %% Check if function was called with any arguments
   84:             case meck:called(Module, Function, '_') of
   85:                 true -> ok;
   86:                 false ->
   87:                     timer:sleep(IntervalMs),
   88:                     wait_for_meck_call(Module, Function, Args, MaxWaitMs - IntervalMs, IntervalMs)
   89:             end;
   90:         _ when is_list(Args) ->
   91:             %% Check if function was called with specific arguments
   92:             case meck:called(Module, Function, Args) of
   93:                 true -> ok;
   94:                 false ->
   95:                     timer:sleep(IntervalMs),
   96:                     wait_for_meck_call(Module, Function, Args, MaxWaitMs - IntervalMs, IntervalMs)
   97:             end
   98:     end;
   99: wait_for_meck_call(Module, Function, Args, _MaxWaitMs, _IntervalMs) ->
  100:     case Args of
  101:         '_' ->
  102:             ct:fail("Timeout waiting for ~p:~p to be called", [Module, Function]);
  103:         _ when is_list(Args) ->
  104:             ct:fail("Timeout waiting for ~p:~p/~p to be called", [Module, Function, length(Args)]);
  105:         _ ->
  106:             ct:fail("Timeout waiting for ~p:~p with args ~p to be called", [Module, Function, Args])
  107:     end.
  108: 
  109: %% @doc Wait and verify that meck function was NOT called (bounded polling)
  110: %% Args can be a list or '_' for any arguments
  111: wait_for_no_meck_call(Module, Function, Args, MaxWaitMs) ->
  112:     wait_for_no_meck_call(Module, Function, Args, MaxWaitMs, 10).
  113: 
  114: wait_for_no_meck_call(Module, Function, Args, MaxWaitMs, IntervalMs) when MaxWaitMs > 0 ->
  115:     %% Check if function was called with matching arguments
  116:     case Args of
  117:         '_' ->
  118:             %% Check if function was called with any arguments
  119:             case meck:called(Module, Function, '_') of
  120:                 true ->
  121:                     N = meck:num_calls(Module, Function, '_'),
  122:                     ct:fail("Unexpected call to ~p:~p (called ~p times)", [Module, Function, N]);
  123:                 false ->
  124:                     timer:sleep(IntervalMs),
  125:                     wait_for_no_meck_call(Module, Function, Args, MaxWaitMs - IntervalMs, IntervalMs)
  126:             end;
  127:         _ when is_list(Args) ->
  128:             %% Check if function was called with specific arguments
  129:             case meck:called(Module, Function, Args) of
  130:                 true ->
  131:                     ct:fail("Unexpected call to ~p:~p/~p", [Module, Function, length(Args)]);
  132:                 false ->
  133:                     timer:sleep(IntervalMs),
  134:                     wait_for_no_meck_call(Module, Function, Args, MaxWaitMs - IntervalMs, IntervalMs)
  135:             end
  136:     end;
  137: wait_for_no_meck_call(_Module, _Function, _Args, _MaxWaitMs, _IntervalMs) ->
  138:     %% Timeout reached, function was not called (expected)
  139:     ok.
  140: 
  141: %% Test: Parse valid ExecResult
  142: test_result_parsing(_Config) ->
  143:     Result = #{
  144:         <<"assignment_id">> => <<"assign-123">>,
  145:         <<"request_id">> => <<"req-456">>,
  146:         <<"status">> => <<"success">>,
  147:         <<"provider_id">> => <<"openai:gpt-4o">>,
  148:         <<"job">> => #{<<"type">> => <<"text.generate">>},
  149:         <<"latency_ms">> => 850,
  150:         <<"cost">> => 0.012,
  151:         <<"trace_id">> => <<"tr-789">>,
  152:         <<"tenant_id">> => <<"acme">>,
  153:         <<"timestamp">> => erlang:system_time(millisecond)
  154:     },
  155:     ResultJson = jsx:encode(Result),
  156:     
  157:     %% Mock NATS to capture usage event
  158:     meck:new(router_nats, [passthrough]),
  159:     meck:expect(router_nats, publish, fun(_Subject, _Payload) -> ok end),
  160:     
  161:     %% Process result (simulate message handling)
  162:     router_result_consumer:handle_info({nats_message, <<"caf.exec.result.v1">>, ResultJson}, #{}),
  163:     
  164:     %% Verify usage event was published (bounded wait)
  165:     wait_for_meck_call(router_nats, publish, '_', 1000),
  166:     meck:unload(router_nats),
  167:     ok.
  168: 
  169: %% Test: Correlation by assignment_id/request_id
  170: test_result_correlation(_Config) ->
  171:     AssignmentId = <<"assign-correlate">>,
  172:     RequestId = <<"req-correlate">>,
  173:     Result = #{
  174:         <<"assignment_id">> => AssignmentId,
  175:         <<"request_id">> => RequestId,
  176:         <<"status">> => <<"success">>,
  177:         <<"provider_id">> => <<"openai:gpt-4o">>,
  178:         <<"job">> => #{<<"type">> => <<"text.generate">>},
  179:         <<"latency_ms">> => 850,
  180:         <<"cost">> => 0.012,
  181:         <<"tenant_id">> => <<"acme">>
  182:     },
  183:     ResultJson = jsx:encode(Result),
  184:     
  185:     meck:new(router_nats, [passthrough]),
  186:     meck:expect(router_nats, publish, fun(_Subject, Payload) ->
  187:         UsageMap = jsx:decode(Payload, [return_maps]),
  188:         %% Verify correlation IDs are present
  189:         maps:get(<<"assignment_id">>, UsageMap) =:= AssignmentId,
  190:         maps:get(<<"request_id">>, UsageMap) =:= RequestId,
  191:         ok
  192:     end),
  193:     
  194:     router_result_consumer:handle_info({nats_message, <<"caf.exec.result.v1">>, ResultJson}, #{}),
  195:     
  196:     %% Verify usage event was published with correct correlation IDs (bounded wait)
  197:     wait_for_meck_call(router_nats, publish, '_', 1000),
  198:     
  199:     %% Verify the call was made with correct arguments
  200:     case meck:history(router_nats) of
  201:         [{_Pid, {router_nats, publish, [Subject, Payload]}, _Result}] ->
  202:             UsageMap = jsx:decode(Payload, [return_maps]),
  203:             %% Verify correlation IDs are present
  204:             AssignmentId =:= maps:get(<<"assignment_id">>, UsageMap, undefined),
  205:             RequestId =:= maps:get(<<"request_id">>, UsageMap, undefined);
  206:         _ ->
  207:             ct:fail("Expected exactly one call to router_nats:publish, got: ~p", [meck:history(router_nats)])
  208:     end,
  209:     
  210:     meck:unload(router_nats),
  211:     ok.
  212: 
  213: %% Test: Usage event emission
  214: test_usage_emission(_Config) ->
  215:     Result = #{
  216:         <<"assignment_id">> => <<"assign-usage">>,
  217:         <<"request_id">> => <<"req-usage">>,
  218:         <<"status">> => <<"success">>,
  219:         <<"provider_id">> => <<"openai:gpt-4o">>,
  220:         <<"job">> => #{<<"type">> => <<"text.generate">>},
  221:         <<"latency_ms">> => 850,
  222:         <<"cost">> => 0.012,
  223:         <<"tenant_id">> => <<"acme">>
  224:     },
  225:     ResultJson = jsx:encode(Result),
  226:     
  227:     meck:new(router_nats, [passthrough]),
  228:     meck:expect(router_nats, publish, fun(Subject, Payload) ->
  229:         case Subject of
  230:             <<"beamline.usage.v1.metered">> ->
  231:                 UsageMap = jsx:decode(Payload, [return_maps]),
  232:                 %% Verify usage message structure
  233:                 maps:is_key(<<"version">>, UsageMap) andalso
  234:                 maps:is_key(<<"tenant_id">>, UsageMap) andalso
  235:                 maps:is_key(<<"provider_id">>, UsageMap) andalso
  236:                 maps:is_key(<<"event_type">>, UsageMap) andalso
  237:                 maps:is_key(<<"latency_ms">>, UsageMap) andalso
  238:                 maps:is_key(<<"cost">>, UsageMap) andalso
  239:                 maps:is_key(<<"status">>, UsageMap);
  240:             _ ->
  241:                 false
  242:         end,
  243:         ok
  244:     end),
  245:     
  246:     router_result_consumer:handle_info({nats_message, <<"caf.exec.result.v1">>, ResultJson}, #{}),
  247:     
  248:     %% Verify usage event was published with correct structure (bounded wait)
  249:     wait_for_meck_call(router_nats, publish, '_', 1000),
  250:     
  251:     %% Verify the call was made with correct subject and payload structure
  252:     case meck:history(router_nats) of
  253:         [{_Pid, {router_nats, publish, [Subject, Payload]}, _Result}] ->
  254:             case Subject of
  255:                 <<"beamline.usage.v1.metered">> ->
  256:                     UsageMap = jsx:decode(Payload, [return_maps]),
  257:                     %% Verify usage message structure
  258:                     _ = maps:is_key(<<"version">>, UsageMap) andalso
  259:                     maps:is_key(<<"tenant_id">>, UsageMap) andalso
  260:                     maps:is_key(<<"provider_id">>, UsageMap) andalso
  261:                     maps:is_key(<<"event_type">>, UsageMap) andalso
  262:                     maps:is_key(<<"latency_ms">>, UsageMap) andalso
  263:                     maps:is_key(<<"cost">>, UsageMap) andalso
  264:                     maps:is_key(<<"status">>, UsageMap);
  265:                 _ ->
  266:                     ct:fail("Expected subject 'beamline.usage.v1.metered', got: ~p", [Subject])
  267:             end;
  268:         _ ->
  269:             ct:fail("Expected exactly one call to router_nats:publish, got: ~p", [meck:history(router_nats)])
  270:     end,
  271:     
  272:     meck:unload(router_nats),
  273:     ok.
  274: 
  275: %% Test: Result validation
  276: test_result_validation(_Config) ->
  277:     %% Test missing assignment_id and request_id
  278:     Result1 = #{
  279:         <<"status">> => <<"success">>
  280:     },
  281:     Result1Json = jsx:encode(Result1),
  282:     
  283:     meck:new(router_nats, [passthrough]),
  284:     meck:expect(router_nats, publish, fun(_Subject, _Payload) -> ok end),
  285:     
  286:     router_result_consumer:handle_info({nats_message, <<"caf.exec.result.v1">>, Result1Json}, #{}),
  287:     
  288:     %% Should not publish usage (validation failed) - use bounded wait to verify
  289:     wait_for_no_meck_call(router_nats, publish, '_', 200),
  290:     meck:unload(router_nats),
  291:     ok.
  292: 
  293: %% Test: Malformed JSON
  294: test_malformed_json(_Config) ->
  295:     MalformedJson = <<"{invalid json}">>,
  296:     
  297:     meck:new(router_nats, [passthrough]),
  298:     meck:expect(router_nats, publish, fun(_Subject, _Payload) -> ok end),
  299:     
  300:     gen_server:call(router_result_consumer, {test_message, <<"caf.exec.result.v1">>, MalformedJson}),
  301:     
  302:     %% Should not crash, should log error - use bounded wait to verify no publication
  303:     wait_for_no_meck_call(router_nats, publish, '_', 200),
  304:     meck:unload(router_nats),
  305:     ok.
  306: 
  307: %% Test: Missing required fields
  308: test_missing_fields(_Config) ->
  309:     Result = #{
  310:         <<"assignment_id">> => <<"assign-missing">>,
  311:         <<"request_id">> => <<"req-missing">>
  312:         %% Missing status
  313:     },
  314:     ResultJson = jsx:encode(Result),
  315:     
  316:     meck:new(router_nats, [passthrough]),
  317:     meck:expect(router_nats, publish, fun(_Subject, _Payload) -> ok end),
  318:     
  319:     gen_server:call(router_result_consumer, {test_message, <<"caf.exec.result.v1">>, ResultJson}),
  320:     
  321:     %% Should not publish usage (validation failed) - use bounded wait to verify
  322:     wait_for_no_meck_call(router_nats, publish, ['_', '_'], 200),
  323:     meck:unload(router_nats),
  324:     ok.
